en.title: Pregnancy Calculator
en.seoTitle: Pregnancy Calculator - When Is My Due Date?
en.metaDescription: Free pregnancy calculator to calculate your due date, how many weeks pregnant you are, and track your pregnancy timeline. Based on last menstrual period or conception date.
longTailKeywords: how many weeks pregnant am i calculator
pregnancy due date by conception date
when is my due date calculator
en.description: Calculate your pregnancy due date and track your weeks of pregnancy. Enter your last menstrual period (LMP) or conception date to get an accurate pregnancy timeline, estimated delivery date, and current week of pregnancy.
en.summary: Calculate due date and pregnancy weeks with LMP or conception date.
instructions: Enter your last menstrual period (LMP) date
See your current pregnancy week and day

seoContent.introduction: Our pregnancy calculator helps you determine your estimated due date and track your weeks of pregnancy. Whether you know your last menstrual period (LMP) or conception date, this calculator provides an accurate pregnancy timeline, helping you plan and prepare for your baby's arrival.
benefits: Calculate accurate due date from LMP or conception date
Track current week and day of pregnancy
See trimester information
Plan prenatal care appointments
Understand pregnancy milestones by week
Share estimated due date with family and healthcare providers
steps: Enter your values in the input fields provided
Review the automatic calculations and results
Adjust inputs to explore different scenarios
Use the results for your planning and decision-making
Save or share your calculations as needed
Consult professionals for personalized advice
inputsExplained: Last Menstrual Period (LMP): The first day of your last period before pregnancy
Conception Date: The estimated date of conception
Standard Pregnancy: Calculated as 280 days (40 weeks) from LMP
seoContent.formulaExplanation: Pregnancy due date is typically calculated as 280 days (40 weeks) from the first day of the last menstrual period. This is called Naegele's rule. If you know your conception date, 266 days are added. Most pregnancies last between 266-280 days, with variation being normal.
examples: At 20 weeks: Halfway through pregnancy, anatomy ultrasound typically performed
resultsExplanation: Due Date: Estimated delivery date (±2 weeks variation is normal)
Current Week: Your current week of pregnancy (0-40 weeks)
Current Day: Day within the current week (0-6)
Days Remaining: Days until estimated due date
seoContent.whoItsFor: This pregnancy calculator is essential for pregnant women and couples trying to understand their pregnancy timeline, healthcare providers scheduling prenatal visits, family members and friends wanting to know when baby is expected, and anyone needing to calculate pregnancy dates for medical, personal, or planning purposes.
seoContent.disclaimer: This pregnancy calculator provides an estimated due date based on standard pregnancy calculations. Due dates are estimates only, with most babies born within 2 weeks before or after the calculated date. Ultrasound dating in early pregnancy is the most accurate method. Always consult with your healthcare provider for personalized pregnancy timeline and medical advice. This calculator is for informational purposes only.
relatedTools: Due date calculator for additional calculations
Weeks calculator for other date calculations

faqs.question: How accurate is this calculator?
faqs.answer: This calculator uses industry-standard formulas to provide accurate results based on your inputs. Results are estimates and may vary.

faqs.question: What information do I need?
faqs.answer: You'll need the specific input values required by the calculator. All required fields are clearly labeled.

faqs.question: Can I save my results?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can save results by taking a screenshot or noting the values for future reference.

faqs.question: Is my data secure?
faqs.answer: Yes, all calculations are performed locally in your browser. We don't store your data.

faqs.question: How often should I use this?
faqs.answer: Use the calculator whenever you need to make calculations or when your situation changes.
